content.question: Directions: Answers must be in essay form. Outline form is not acceptable. Labeled diagrams may be used to supplement discussion, but in no case will a diagram alone suffice. It is important that you read each question completely before you begin. The unit of genetic organization in all living organisms is the chromosome. (a) Describe the structure and function of the parts of a eukaryotic chromosome. You may wish to include a diagram as part of your description.

frqParts.text: Directions: Answers must be in essay form. Outline form is not acceptable. Labeled diagrams may be used to supplement discussion, but in no case will a diagram alone suffice. It is important that you read each question completely before you begin. The unit of genetic organization in all living organisms is the chromosome. (a) Describe the structure and function of the parts of a eukaryotic chromosome. You may wish to include a diagram as part of your description.
(b) Describe the adaptive (evolutionary) significance of organizing genes into chromosomes.
(c) How does the function and structure of the chromosome differ in prokaryotes?
